website_summaries.verdict: If you tend to cook quicker meals, this microwave rice cooker is an affordable pick that produces delicious rice in minutes.
pros: A simple, 2.6-litre rice cooker that produces a batch of microwave rice in just over 10 minutes
Can also be used to cook pasta
cons: Too large to fit in some microwaves
No instructions for cooking different quantities

customer_reviews.title: The first time I used it using long grain white ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it using long grain white rice it cooked perfectly. I decided to try brown rice and the directions said to go by package directions which I attempted to do. Just a few minutes into the cooking cycle the rice caught fire then the entire pot. It even burned a hole in the bottom. The entire house smelled for days and cleaning the microwave was a chore. There is no way I can return it for credit but I do have several pictures showing damage but there is not a method to communicate that to Amazon. All I want is a refund but there is no one to talk to.. I do not want a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Slack

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty great! ... my girlfriend was a little curious about it, and ordered it... did not expect it to work as well as it does. 20 minutes makes you perfect rice in the microwave (she's used it twice so far)... make sure you DO NOT!! Again DO NOT!! Add any oil or butter, otherwise, like other reviewers, it will melt in your microwave. If you follow that simple direction, you will get perfect rice every time.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Second use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a particularly great nor terrible microwave, just a rather normal middle of the road model. I tried cooking rice with broth, which the instructions said was allowed and halfway through had to yank this melted disaster outside and toss in on the porch to relax the fire alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Sudz

customer_reviews.title: Rice cooker. This works good.
customer_reviews.text: Hello again, back with another review. The spag shoebox looking thing I reviewed last time was great and this rice cooker thing is also great. I can eat for less than a dollar a day with these two things. Add in some meat juice or some sort of liquid flavoring, and you have a great meal on a budget. And, to round it out and make sure you get all your nutrients, get some flintstone vits. Ya got fiber, stuff that packs your belly, vits and all for under a buck a day. Mmm Mmm cheap eating.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Came cracked already but box was all good which brings me to question of quality???
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived cracked on the side today however the box was all good and even had those air packets inside to protect from extreme pressure. Disappointed!

customer_reviews.title: Works Great-But....
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 2 years, I use it often to steam raw veggies and last week I melted chocolate in it...I can't deal with the feet on it though! The steamer will inevitably mess up my glass circular tray in the microwave so I have to be ever so careful putting it in and taking it out. When it's hot, there's no place to really get a good grip on it, so the feet will loosen the glass tray in the oven if I tilt it slightly. It needs handles on the actual pot and maybe more solid feet rather than a tiny bit of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: S Goryan

customer_reviews.title: Winner! Perfect rice everytime.
customer_reviews.text: Best rice I have ever made. So easy, turns out perfect everytime. I use 1 cup of basmati rice and 1 cup of water. I add a little extra water, about 2-3 tablespoons and a knob of butter. Wash your rice beforehand. Pop it in the microwave for 12-13 mins. And VOILA!!! Perfect rice.... I have done 2 cups of rice with 2 and 1/4 cups water with a knob of butter. 13 mins and done. My kids used to hate my mushy rice I used to make!!!! This takes the headache and cleaning out of it. Winner!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: It does not have any handles on the pot or the lid which makes it hard to pick up, put in the micro, etc. The 4 hold down 'clamps' around the lid keep coming off. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy London

customer_reviews.title: Only makes a half cup (uncooked) at a time
customer_reviews.text: While the cooker has a nearly 3 liter capacity, if you read the directions, you aren't supposed to cook more than a half cup uncooked at a time. That's not a lot of rice...but it is enough for wife and me. Also, you can't add any oil or fat of any kind while cooking according to the directions. Most folks do like to season and add flavor while cooking, but ya can't do it with this thing. I still rate it 4 stars because it does what I want....cook rice without messing up the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love rice, but I hate cleaning my stove when the pot boils over. This pot solves that problem. Put the rice and water in the pot--put it in the microwave--and a few minutes later you have perfectly cooked rice. As an aside, you might need to adjust the time according to your elevation. It's not a big deal to do, just something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Cruztalker

customer_reviews.title: A quick and great way to cook regular bag rice.
customer_reviews.text: Years ago we had a similar microwave rice cooker. We moved and we haven't seen it yet. That's beside the point but I want to tell you this is the perfect way to make perfect rice. It is a lot quicker too. I got motivated to buy another after years of not too great rice experiences. The only thing I have to complain about is there really is no directions with it. You can use it as a vegetable steamer too but you have to figure that out on your own. It might be a small complaint but I think it is a big issue for people wanting to use it correctly.

I can't make good rice, so the fact that my recipe ratio may be off the Sistema still makes rice perfect.

I’m not giving a bad review because this thing works great!!!! I’m using a temp fix until I get my clip
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: So easy to make perfect rice!
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker makes cooking rice SO easy! Very sturdy plastic, simple to use - add rice, water, put on lids - done. NO boil overs on stove! Which I always had. I think you have to experiment a little as to what cooking time works with your microwave. The recommended time range is 12-14 min, 12 wasn't quite enough for me - I use 14 min. Perfect rice every time. Also have used for oatmeal and quinoa. Works great - easy to use, easy to clean. Plastic seems solid enough to last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Easy as it gets
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I didn't have a measuring cup at hand. I used a coffee cup and just did equal amounts of water/rice (2 to 1) and placed it in the steamer and hit the microwave for 20 minutes. Absolutely perfect rice. Who has time to drag out a pot, fill it with water, wait for it to boil, pour in rice, put a top on the pan, put it on simmer and wait and hope you've done everything right and it won't burn. Never again. Plus, who wants to wash all those dishes? Not me!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous One

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Rice
customer_reviews.text: This fantastic little rice steamer really does the trick. We have a larger electric steamer, but it doesn't work well with smaller portions and we always ended up wasting rice. The Sistema Microwave Rice Steamer is great when you just want a cup or two. Each batch is perfectly done and delicious. Plus, though it may not be advised, I can easily make Rice-a-Roni boxed rice in this steamer without any issues beyond a little discoloration due to the flavor packets, but I expected that. This is great when we want a little Spanish Rice or something done quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Wendee Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice every time!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this rice cooker. There’s no over flow mess like when cooking in a pot on the stove, no rice stuck or burnt at the bottom like on the stove or in a traditional rice cooker. Easy to wash in the dishwasher. And fits in a small microwave. Two cups of rice in 30mins. Perfect for dorm life and small apartment living!!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha "Laura" Wennberg

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: We love this rice cooker. It took me a couple tries to get the cooking time right but the rice comes out perfectly each time. It is not the easiest item to clean with the nooks and crannies in the lid but worth it in my opinion. Nothing burns or melts, not sure what is up with the other reviews claiming burning or melting. I microwave one cup of washed rice with 2 cups of water for 17 minutes and it comes out perfectly every time!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful seller
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to make rice. When I received it I was delightfully surprised to see it also cooks quinoa and other grains. The seller is efficient, my product shipped on time, and very anxious to please. They answer all concerns or questions immediately, which makes this a very pleasant experience. I highly recommend this seller and know you will be happy with anything you purchase from them. I give them a five star thumbs up

It is great to re-warm soup, if you have a large amount (too big for single soup serving) I gave it to a friend to try it out and she was not impressed either.

I had to add water and put it back in the microwave a few times...so in the end I didn't save any time and my rice came out just ok. I don't want to spend all my time guessing to get my rice right when I could spend a little extra time w/ an electric one and get great results. On a plus side, the quality seemed good.

customer_reviews.title: Needs Work

Good results probably depend on working out the exact amounts of rice, water, and cooking time that suit your particular microwave, using the Sistema's sketchy directions as a starting point (ditto for every other food you choose to cook). I could do this if I had to - but I've gone back to the simplicity and reliability of a pot on a stove.
customer_reviews.author: Jack11615

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful little steamer. It's the perfect size to steam for a family of 4 (2 adults & 2 small kids). I haven't tried steaming more than the portion size I usually cook. It steamed parboiled rice in 11 minutes in my microwave. I just used the directions on the rice because the ones that come with it are not very clear unless you understand those measurements. It's small enough to store and not be in my way. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a simple rice steamer that you can throw in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Cooks Rice easily
customer_reviews.text: I got this mainly to cook rice faster than on the stove or in a rice cooker. It does it's job and with just a little adjustment makes rice pretty well. I tend to cook whole grain brown rice which took a bit of trail and error perfecting but it does what it is suppose to do.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this cooker for over two years. It's my go to cooker for rice. I only cook rice in the microwave these days. It's easy to use and my rice comes our perfect every time. I also use it to cook potatoes and pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: It took some experimenting with rice vs water vs time cooked, but I have worked it out. I used the manual to start with and now it's fine. I do use paper towels to catch overflow that does occasionally happen. I use 3-4 times a week, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Eason

customer_reviews.title: As good as you could want
customer_reviews.text: It had actually crossed my mind a couple of times to get an electric rice cooker, but who needs 1 more appliance to take up space. Came across this while perusing Sistema products after I got a covered bowl for soup. Perfect! Nice & small, works great, no boil overs in the microwave, no heavy hot bowl to try to lift. Rice came out perfect the first time. Love the rice paddle, easy to handle, stores inside. Update 10/18.... Still love this. It also works great for Quinoa and the pre-seasoned rice packets.
customer_reviews.author: GLK

customer_reviews.title: Good deal with some caution
customer_reviews.text: It looks like it will work well. I got it because all of my mother's appliances are red in her kitchen. One word of caution: It does not come with a box, measurements are in on the metric system (milliliters and grams) and it only gives you cooking instructions for "4 standard servings" when it has an 11 cup capacity. There might need to be some experimenting with the timing and water added, which may not be a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Pediatrician and Mom

customer_reviews.title: A much needed item.
customer_reviews.text: Rice comes out fluffy every time, but try not to drop it because this isn't Tupperware. This is my second cooker. I dropped the first one, half full of water, this is my THIRD cooker. Note to self , never leave cooker at job because someone might steal the center piece.
customer_reviews.author: Back2Normal

customer_reviews.title: This is a Good One
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rice steamer -- I already had one but it was smaller and sometimes isn't big enough for what I need -- especially if I am making pasta in it or enough converted rice for a week. The only real difference between this item and the one I already had is that the handles on this unit are part of the lid, which can give one pause if you are wondering if it will hold. Mine does! The older one that I have (not Sistema) has the handles built into the body, so there really is no fear factor involved in picking up a hot container. However, that said, it works great and I am very happy!
customer_reviews.author: cconnet

I cook it on high for 10 minutes and let it sit for 5 minutes before opening the lid. All the water is gone so I am going to have to make some adjustment to the amount of water I use.

I haven't actually made rice in, yet, but it has worked great with chicken, green beans, corn, and hot dogs
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This makes great rice, more quickly

product_meta.title: Sistema Microwave Collection Rice Cooker, 87.2 oz./2.6 L, Red
product_meta.description: Size:2.6LThe Sistema Microwave Collection Rice Cooker is conveniently designed to cook rice, polenta, and couscous in the microwave. The rice steamer includes a pressure chamber plate that allows any overflow to be collected and then drained back into the base chamber. It also comes with a lid with cool-to-touch, easy-lift tabs, and a nonstick rice spoon. Made from 100% virgin plastic, this BPA- and phthalate-free microwave rice steamer is dishwasher-safe when placed on the top rack, microwave-safe with the vent open, and safe for storing in fridges and freezers.
feature_bullets: Microwave rice steamer designed to cook rice, polenta, and couscous
Steam release vent on lid allows for splatter-free heating
Cool-to-the-touch, easy-lift tabs for easy opening of the rice cooker
Top-rack dishwasher-safe; fridge- and freezer-safe; microwave-safe with the vent open
